app

Class ProcessTheBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.ProcessTheBook

  • public class ProcessTheBook
extends java.lang.Object

    ProcessTheBook

    Notes: This class does not have a constructor. The class will take a text file and process it for word and line count and display relevant information once completed.

    author: Daniel C. Landon Jr.

    instructor: Dr. Bob Walsh

    class: CSCI 202 - Introduction to Software Systems

    date: 01.22.2020

    • Method Detail

      • StartProcessing

        public boolean StartProcessing(java.lang.String _bookToProcess)

        StartProcessing

        Notes: This is the start point for processing the book.

        Parameters:
        _bookToProcess - string indicating the name of the file containg the book to process.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if there was a problem
        Pre-Condition
        text flie must be supplied for processing
        Post-Condition
        application will process book successfully

      • FindWordCount

        protected int FindWordCount(java.lang.String[] _wordArray)

        FindWordCount

        Notes: Takes and array of words and counts them, but it skips anything that is blank.

        Parameters:
        _wordArray - array of words from parsed sentence
        Returns:
        returns the numbers of words found
        Pre-Condition
        an array of words must be supplied
        Post-Condition
        a count of how many words in the array

      • StripSpecialCharacters

        protected java.lang.String StripSpecialCharacters(java.lang.String _lineToProcess)

        StripSpecialCharacters

        Notes: Takes a line of text and removes all non-alpha characters.

        Parameters:
        _lineToProcess - the line of text to process for special characters
        Returns:
        the line after it has been processed
        Pre-Condition
        must be supplied a line of text
        Post-Condition
        line will be modified to where only alph characters will be available

      • FindLongestWord

        protected java.lang.String FindLongestWord(java.lang.String[] _wordArray,
                                           java.lang.String _currentWord)

        FindLongestWord

        Notes: This will sort through the array of words supplied to determine which one is the largest. Once a word is found it will be kept. Any words that come after that are of the same size will be ignored and the first word found will be kept.

        Parameters:
        _wordArray - an array containg the words from the parsed line of text
        _currentWord - the largest word found.
        Returns:
        the largest word
        Pre-Condition
        an array of words, with no special characters must be supplied as well as a variable containg the current largest word
        Post-Condition
        a new variable will ne returned showing the current largest word

      • ConsoleOutput

        protected void ConsoleOutput(int _lineCount,
                             int _wordCount,
                             java.lang.String _largestWord)

        ConsoleDisplay

        Notes: Displays results of the book being processed.

        Parameters:
        _lineCount - number of lines counted
        _wordCount - number of words counted
        _largestWord - largest word found
        Pre-Condition
        variable containing line/word count as well as largest word
        Post-Condition
        simpel output to console based on information supplied
